page.title: 09FARMING & CROFTING IN ASSYNT
page.content: 5O years ago everone Crofted & owned sheep here. Today some 10% of us follow this tradition. A typical year for crofters would be:- January, Find enough feed for the sheep, February- Dose against Liver fluke, March, April, May- Lambing season and dose for Pulpy Kidney.( Each ewe should have three lambs before being sold.) June, July, August- Clipping & Wool selling, Spraying for fly. September- Selling the males & weak females. October- Sheep dipping as required by law & selling of the older sheep (cast ewes) November- The "tup" comes & the sheep are dosed again for Fluke. December- A quiet month for Crofters. Names given to the sheep. First Year- Female is called a Hog, Male is a Dinmot. Second year- Female is called a ewe, Male is called a wether.
